definitions.example: There was a bit of bother at the hairdresser's when they couldn't find my appointment in the book.
Yes, I can do that for you - it's no bother.

definitions.definition: To annoy, to disturb, to irritate.
definitions.example: Would it bother you if I smoked?

definitions.definition: To feel care or anxiety; to make or take trouble; to be troublesome.
definitions.example: Why do I even bother to try?

definitions.definition: To do something which is of negligible inconvenience.
definitions.example: You didn't even bother to close the door.
